name: Gingivitis
description: Inflammation of the gums

name: Tooth decay
description: Damage to the tooth enamel by bacterial acid

name: Periodontitis
description: Infection of the gums and bone that support the teeth

name: Dental abscess
description: Infection at the root of a tooth or between the gum and a tooth

name: Bruxism
description: Excessive grinding of teeth or clenching of the jaw

name: Halitosis
description: Chronic bad breath

name: Oral cancer
description: Abnormal growth of cells in the mouth

name: Dental erosion
description: Loss of tooth enamel due to acid exposure

name: Malocclusion
description: Misalignment of the teeth or jaws

name: Dry mouth
description: Lack of sufficient saliva
symptoms: Dry or sticky feeling in the mouth

name: Dental hypersensitivity
description: Pain or discomfort in the teeth due to external stimuli
symptoms: Pain or discomfort when eating/drinking hot or cold items
Tooth sensitivity to air or touch

name: Periapical abscess
description: Abscess at the tip of the root of a tooth

name: Oral thrush
description: Fungal infection in the mouth
symptoms: White spots or patches in the mouth

name: Impacted tooth
description: Tooth that is blocked from emerging into the mouth

name: Dental trauma
description: Injury to the teeth or surrounding tissues
symptoms: Pain or discomfort in the mouth

name: Enamel hypoplasia
description: Incomplete or defective formation of tooth enamel
symptoms: Yellow or brown spots on teeth

name: Dental phobia
description: Fear of receiving dental treatment
symptoms: Physical symptoms such as sweating or trembling

name: Erosive lichen planus
description: Chronic inflammatory condition that affects the mucous membranes
symptoms: Painful open sores in the mouth
Red or white patches in the mouth

name: Erythroplakia
description: Red patches or lesions on the mucous membranes
symptoms: Red or white patches or lesions in the mouth
Pain or discomfort in the mouth
treatments: Biopsy to determine if it is cancerous or precancerous
Surgery to remove the affected tissue

name: Oral submucous fibrosis
description: Chronic progressive scarring of the mucous membranes
treatments: Steroids to reduce inflammation and scarring
Avoidance of irritants such as tobacco and betel nut

name: Mucosal pemphigoid
description: Autoimmune disease that affects the mucous membranes

name: Tooth extraction
description: The removal of a tooth or teeth from its socket in the jawbone.
symptoms: Trauma or injury to the tooth

name: Gummy smile
description: A condition where an excessive amount of gum tissue is visible when a person smiles.

name: Cleft lip/palate
description: A congenital defect in which the lip or palate fails to fuse properly during fetal development.
symptoms: Visible split or gap in the lip or palate
treatments: Surgery to repair the lip or palate

name: Obstructive sleep apnea
description: A sleep disorder where breathing is repeatedly interrupted during sleep due to collapsed airways.
treatments: Oral appliances to position the jaw and tongue
